intro: Minuartia akinfiewii, commonly known as the Arctic sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to arctic and alpine regions, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments. The plant typically grows close to the ground, with delicate, hairy stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in nutrient-poor soils. Minuartia akinfiewii is often found in rocky or sandy substrates, showcasing its resilience to extreme climatic conditions.
